text:
We have created the PDF file thru APache FOP but when we are unable to read the data thru QTP(it's an HP Automation tool).

Do u have any addin's to install with QTP to read the FOP pdf?

Is their any tool which convert the Apache FOP to Adobe PDF file?

I have attached the screenshot which give's u a fair idea that how the FOP pdf file behaving when working with QTP, while capturing the data in  FOP PDF it does not return any value.

For more reference please the attached file.
creator: sumititer@gmail.com
sumititer@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 27802
Not able to read data

FOP produces Adobe PDF. If there is a PDF compliance error in the output PDF, then you need to identify that error buy providing more information, such as the original input FO and output PDF files.

Have you tested the output PDF produced by FOP using other PDF readers?
creator: gadams@apache.org
sumititer@gmail.com
text:
Output FOP PDF file is created successfully thier is not problem in that thing.
But while trying to read the text thru QTP we are not able to extractthe data.

Do we have any code in VBSCRIPT /tool to do it.

Note :- Text is readable by QTP, when the pdf is created from Adobe pdf generator.For doing this we just need to install a plugin called Acro QTP.

What FOP version do you use?
What QTP version do you use?
Is there any error message from QTP?

Reading your description, it's difficult to point the source of the issue.

FOP or QTP?
creator: pascal.sancho@takoma.fr
gadams@apache.org
text: resolved invalid due to lack of information (FO input file, PDF output file, etc)
